This feature shows the current music track info within an Ambient display screen.

It can be triggered without having ambient display enabled by using the (forced) option.

Normal view includes the lockscreen clock, date and ticker.

Minimal view includes just the ticker at the center of the screen.

You can double tap on track info to skip track.

Send a logcat, a dmesg or a kmesg for a better support. Just be sure to be rooted.
Everything is done now, so, it\'s your time to send the logs to us.

Everything is done now, so, it\'s your time to send the logs to... Hey, you\'re running an unshishufied build, so, if you know who did this build, please take the logs to who made the build before sending them to us.
Be patient for the logs to be created
Action failed because of missing superuser access

Maybe you're here and wondering "What the hell is all this and what i have to send?"
Well, here's some info about the stuff you can send:

Logcat: It's the way that Android outputs all system events, like errors, crashes, or even info about a process being run. Ideal for crashes and FCs.

Dmesg: It outputs some of the kernel messages, but filtering stuff that users may not care… if they do care

Kmesg: It's the same as Dmesg but without the filters, giving more info about all the kernel events. Ideal for random reboots.

Blur personalizations are disabled during keyguard view! Only translucent notifications are enabled!

These colors are the ones tinting the blur background. Instead of the normal grey, you can now choose the colors in the way you like. 
 There are three color filters: One used for light backgrounds, one used for dark backgrounds and one used for light/dark backgrounds. 
 So how are these colors working?? 
 Simple, as the titles say, the light filter will be used for lighter backgrounds, dark filter for dark backgrounds and the mixed filter one will be used for backgrounds not too dark but neither too light. 
 These colors are used for both BlurBackgrounds: StatusBar one and RecentsApps one
Blur personalizations are disabled during Keyguard view! Only Translucent Notifications are enabled!

To clear all apps, pinch-in with two fingers on the panel. To block an app from being cleared, long press on its icon to star it.\n\nFor additional recents features such as multiwindow or to kill an app, long press on any app window in the panel.

Changing the icon shape will only affect new started apps. Thus, it is recommended to reboot your device to fully apply this setting. If some apps still use the old shape after that, try clearing their app cache.
